head.title: World Briefing | Africa: Zimbabwe: Aid Groups' Status Revoked

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Africa: Zimbabwe: Aid Groups' Status Revoked

block.p: The government appeared to revoke the legal basis for all nongovernmental organizations to operate inside the country, arguing that some of the groups have provided cover for Western governments seeking to overthrow Robert G. Mugabe, the nation's autocratic president. The state-run broadcaster Zimbabwe Television said the revocations would give officials time to ''screen out agents of imperialism from genuine organizations working to uplift the well-being of the poor.'' Mr. Mugabe has often accused private nongovernmental organizations of secretly channeling aid to the Movement for Democratic Change, the lone opposition party of note inside the country.
